utterances.speaker: JEANINE PIRRO, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: Hello everyone. I am Judge Jeanine Pirro along with Geraldo Rivera, Jesse Watters, Dana Perino, and Greg Gutfeld. It's 5:00 in New York City and this is THE FIVE. There is a major meltdown happening over the mere suggestion of ever returning to normal. Liberal comedian Bill Maher and Bari Weis being hammered by the media bias suggesting it is time we learn to live with COVID.

utterances.speaker: BILL MAHER, HOST, REAL TIME WITH BILL MAHER
utterances.sentences: I don't want to live in your paranoid world anymore, your masked paranoid world. You know you go out, it's silly now. You know, you have to have your mask, you have to have a card, you have to have a booster. They scan your head. Like you're a cashier and I'm a bunch of bananas.

utterances.speaker: BARI WEIS, JOURNALIST
utterances.sentences: This is going to be remembered by the younger generation as a catastrophic moral crime.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Those words triggering the partisan press that thinks mandates and COVID rules should be here to stay forever.

utterances.speaker: WHOOPI GOLDBERG, HOST, THE VIEW
utterances.sentences: You don't have to do it, but stay away from everybody. How dare you be so flippant, man?

utterances.speaker: SARA HAINES, HOST, THE VIEW
utterances.sentences: I may never ride a subway again without a mask. I may never go indoors to big crowds and never feel comfortable without a mask and that's up to me to do that.

utterances.speaker: JIM ACOSTA, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: She told Bari Weiss essentially she needed to grow up.

utterances.speaker: JONATHAN REINER, CNN MEDICAL ANALYST
utterances.sentences: Yes, she needs to grow because she is acting like a child.

utterances.speaker: MEHDI HASAN, MSNBC HOST
utterances.sentences: My young children handled this pandemic more maturely and less childishly than the likes of Bari Weiss.

utterances.speaker: DON LEMON, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: Bari that was messed up. Too many people are making this about politics, even libertarians, right? I think Bill is libertarian, I'm not sure. They give, you know, comedians a lot of leeway, but this was not funny.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: And how's this for crazy? Some schools in Virginia are now segregating students who don't wear a mask. It is in defiance of Governor Glenn Youngkin's executive order that lets parents decide if their kid should be forced to cover up. Those schools now separating students and saying they won't be able to learn in person unless they comply. Okay, Jesse, I'll start with you since you're the star of the day.

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: Oh, stop it. Now you're embarrassing me.

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: No, you're never embarrassed.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: No, you aren't. You love it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You know me well.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: All right. So, why is there so much resistance to this? The numbers are down, the lethality is down. You know, why, at some point we have to return to normal.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: No, no, no. Half the country will never return. It's like a religion now, COVIDism. I can make up words too now, Greg. You started seeing the cracks though when Gayle King said she wanted to break the lock down and then run buck naked through Times Square. Then you have Maher coming out. You have AOC, you know, she got sick partying down in South Beach. So there is part of the party that wants to live free. But there is going to be people that are bitter clingers, remember those, the bitter clingers, the dead-enders, and they are going to stay until there is only one more case count in the United States because, judge, it's given their life meaning. They like the structure. They like to submit. Before, maybe they didn't have a way to find meaning in their lives, but now they have a doctor and they have a ritual, they are, you know, Cuomo- sexuals. They worship Fauci. And maybe it's in place of religion. I don't know, but there is a part of a human desire to kind of want rules to follow and then be able to judge other people that don't follow those rules. Now, the media likes it too because the media, number one, it gives them ratings and number two, it lets them be the snobs that they naturally are. So, while they're telling people what to do, other people will, yes, they will follow those rules. They will wear the face shield while they wash their blueberries with gloves and that will never end. And that will never end. And you know, Pfizer's got the money train going. These governors have the emergency powers. They're going to milk it for as long as possible.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Okay, so Dana, I saw you writing something down.

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: I'm writing furiously.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Go ahead.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, a couple of things. So, I think that one of the reasons you see Biden's numbers where they are is there's a lot of things, but one of the big ones is he didn't crush the virus, but also there is a wariness because we are not returning to normal. And there are -- now there is a reluctance to return to normal. And you had what I wrote down was that there is this poll this week that said that people who are twice vaccinated and boosted are more worried about getting COVID right now than the unvaccinated are worried about getting COVID. Also you have this other dynamic though with parents. I think 2022 is going to be the year that the parents roar and you will see this across the country. We saw it in Virginia, a little bit in New Jersey. You're going to see it across the country. Sixty-five percent of parents said they were more worried about their kids missing school than they were about their kids getting COVID. Only 30 percent said they were worried that -- for that. We had this situation in New York where they wear masks for a month. This is supposed to -- it's supposed to end a week from now. Then the governor, she got thrown out and the court said last night, actually no. We're throwing that out. There's a stay and now we're going to -- it's a week more. And instead of just taking the win and being a leader, she said she wants to fight it in court.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And what she could have said is New Yorkers, you did a great job, our case numbers are down, we can go back to not wearing masks in public places, vaccine rules, et cetera, et cetera. They told us to follow the science, but now they are not, and I think that that's why you see Biden's numbers also continuing to creep up.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: It's interesting how you made the connection between the two, but Geraldo, I want to ask you. There are some polls that are saying that younger people are more worried than medically vulnerable older people.

utterances.speaker: GUTFEDL
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Is that indoctrination? Is that a continuation? Because if you are older, you know that you're vulnerable.

utterances.speaker: GERALDO RIVERA, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: Erica and I last night, my wife Erica and I had a discussion about the various generations and how much more woke the younger people are, how they are -- they seized on to something. But I am - - I like Bari Weiss. I like Bill Maher, but I'm with Whoopi Goldberg on this. How dare you be so flippant? I mean, as you know, I lost my beloved nephew Bobby Reid, 868,000 Americans have died. I mean, it's a number that you have to really gulp, 868,000 Americans have died. You know, it's -- it will come. It's happening. Why rush it? And in terms of those Virginia parents, they send their unvaccinated kid to a school that's requiring vaccinations, they have to get ready for that child to be isolated in the auditorium, because that's the rule and that -- and you're not -- you are exposing -- even if you think the risk is minuscule in your own heart. That's the rule, you follow the rule. You know, you -- the reason the disease is so worrisome is that it is infectious and you can give it to someone else that it's not you. In other words, you are making the choice not to be vaccinated, you give the disease to someone who has not made that choice, a kid under five years old for example. I think that just calm down, it's coming. Week, two weeks, a month, six m months, some people forever, look at the Japanese, that's okay, not me. But, you know, that's the way it is.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Okay, so Greg, okay, Loudoun County is ground zero. They elected a governor. The governor says they don't have to wear masks. The schools are now segregating the kids.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I'm all for that.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: (Inaudible).

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Effective risk management is not flippant. I don't see anything flippant about that. When the risk is minuscule and you understand risk management, you become the adult in the room and you make the decision. It's the person that uses --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Well, you can't make the decision for me.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, yes I can. I'm not allowing you to tell me to wear a mask.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Then I'm saying you can't come over.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: But, no.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, I'm not coming over to your giant house.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right. Some people --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: There is a room you could go.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, I know the panic room. Something insidious is happening right now. People are becoming okay with this creeping incrementalism, this authoritarianism. It doesn't land on your planet and a giant crate marked authoritarianism. It's like the slow boiling water that a frog is placed and you don't know until entertainers and journalists and the radical we've known for years, Geraldo, starts sounding like the man starts embracing the side of enforcement. Start saying like we can't have any risk in our lives! It all has to be zero or you are evil! That's B.S., right? Right now, you got to be aware of wars that don't have endings. We saw that with Afghanistan. We saw that with the drug war. If you don't want to war without an end, it's up to the sentiment of the population to declare the war over. That means you stop wearing your mask. If you go to stores and you got to restaurants or any establishment and they ask you to wear your mask, you say you know what coming essay, you know what, I'm following the science and you leave. It's time for everybody, I'm not talking about me. I'm not talking about Don Lemon. I'm not talking about Whoopi. I'm talking about the Americans, the viewers, the general public. They have to civilly disobey an end this thing once and for all because the problem is the government is lying to you. They don't -- they act as though the risk of a 10-year-old is the same as an obese 65-year-old smoker. That's B.S. Stop applying different risk to different people.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: It's also a question of manners, good manners.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, no, no. It's actually rude. It's actually rude

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: You scare people by not wearing a mask.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, you --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: No. If you wear the mask.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: -- you just called people flippant --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: You wear the mask.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: -- who've actually been thinking about this for two years. There is no flippancy in making a risk management decision.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Take a deep breath, one more month, two more months.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You've been saying -- you're even saying that for years.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: If it wasn't for omicron --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: We need to flatten Geraldo's curve.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: If it wasn't omicron -- if it wasn't for omicron, we would've been out of this.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes, but it's not lethal. It's not lethal.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Omicron is highly contagious in miles. The masks don't work. It is time to get back to normal even if normal is living with COVID, we have to understand what we've lost because you have accepted the incrementalism of authoritarianism. You got used to the boiling water, Geraldo. That is so not Geraldo in the '70s.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I am a -- I'm a well-mannered person.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That is not Geraldo of the '80s.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I don't want to scare people.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That is not even Geraldo of the '90s.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I don't want scare -- I don't want to freak people out.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Okay. All right everybody, coming up --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I don't want --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Speaking of blowing up, Biden blowing up at Peter Doocy, but it isn't the first time. Is the president cracking under pressure?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: President Biden has a lot on his plate right now from raging inflation, cold war with Russia, plunging poll numbers and a ton of other headaches. Now, new questions over whether he is buckling under the enormous weight of multiple crises. The president's frustration is boiling to the surface as he is caught on a hot mike cursing at our Peter Doocy and it's not the first time the president has lashed out.

utterances.speaker: PETER DOOCY, FOX NEWS WHITE HOUSE CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Do you think that that might incentivize more people to come over illegally?

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA
utterances.sentences: If you guys keep sending that garbage out, yes.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: Why are you so confident it will change his behavior, Mr. President?

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: I'm not confident he'll change his behavior. What the hell, what do you do all the time?

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: Mr. President, can I ask you a quick question on Israel before you drive away since it's so important?

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: No, you can't.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: Why are you waiting on Putin to make the first move, sir?

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: What a stupid question.

utterances.speaker: DOOCY
utterances.sentences: Do you think inflation is a political liability?

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: It's a great asset. More inflation. What a stupid son of a (BLEEP).

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: The president calling Peter to quote, "clear the air" after that encounter. The press secretary Jen Psaki addressing the outburst earlier.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: Does the president regret saying what he said about Peter?

utterances.speaker: JEN PSAKI, WHITE HOUSE PRESS SECRETARY
utterances.sentences: Peter spoke to this. The president called him. He conveyed to him that it was nothing personal, man, and also acknowledged that all of you are going to ask him a range of questions. So, I think that speaks for itself.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: You know, Greg, on "Hannity" to last night, actually several weeks ago is where it originated. I called Dan Bongino a son of a bitch and no one even got mad at me.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. When do we expect that from you, Geraldo? You know, you did make a mistake though. You referred to him as our Peter Doocy. It's our very own Peter Doocy, remember. We don't say that about anybody else to the network, but we always have to say our very own Peter Doocy. But Biden was right, it was a dumb question. Will inflation hurt your chances in the midterm? Of course it will. So, actually Biden was correct. It was a dumb question, but that's the best part about Fox News. We aren't CNN. We aren't wetting our shorts and calling this, you know, an attack on democracy or an insurrection. Every time Acosta acted like a stone tool and got CNN's cavalcade of Karens, you know, fretted about the coming reign of terror. The fact that we find this hilarious and that we can make fun of Peter Doocy says everything about how much fun this network is. But if it were Jim Acosta, they'd have to change Anderson Cooper's sheets. Carl Bernstein would say it's worse than Watergate. And also, if you didn't mind Trump parading the press, you sure -- you shouldn't mind now. I would prefer much more berating of the press and much less real-world problems that you mentioned. All of those real-world problems that are under Biden, I will take that over insults to the press. I think we should be more obnoxious to the press. I do my best.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I really am very concerned about the real world problem in Ukraine.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: But I don't want to be a bummer right now. Don't you, Dana, think that the hit on Biden about his senility, alleged senility and losing his cognitive decline, you know, isn't that a little much?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I mean, I don't --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I mean --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's really not what this is about, really. And no, and I don't say things like that.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: You don't think its --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I don't say things like that about him.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: You don't.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But I do think this. There was a -- in the campaign when he was in the basement, there was this narrative that he was a nice older gentleman who likes ice cream --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- and everything would return to normal or pre-COVID, right? Everything would be okay. And it turns out that he actually is just like us, and he's got an edge, and he is on a hot mike. He could get caught. We could get caught on a hot mic at any moment so I'm a little bit sympathetic to that. But he also showed a lack of being able to be nimble even if it is a dumb question. Take the opportunity and talk to the American people and say, I know inflation is a problem for you. I hear about it -- I heard it from Mary Ann (ph) who was there telling me about the hamburger.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: The hamburgers.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: A very old Mary Anne (ph).

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And that's why I have these people in here today, Peter, and that's what we are going to work on. I'm not too worried about the campaign, but I'm going to -- like just to be able to take an opportunity. The press is going to ask you whatever they ask you, just always like just swing and try to hit it.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: You rely so much on your mom. Your mom about my age, probably a little younger than me and returns her texts. Guiding you morally and philosophically even though you disagree. Now, don't you think that people are too quick to pull the trigger on senility and, you know, all that?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I mean, don't we older folks sometimes bring our wisdom that is very necessary.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I haven't seen any wisdom from Joe Biden, Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: None at all?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: No, not a lot of wisdom. But here's what I think. To compare this to the Trump thing, the difference is, is that the media was calling Trump a racist Russian trader and trying to get him impeached.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right. Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Our very own stupid son of a bitch just asked him about a policy question. He asked him policy so, okay, yes. Like have a little more discipline. I think it's fair as Dana said to say is everything okay because this is not something that normal people do. He's lost control of the presidency. He's obviously missed the last two waves. He missed inflation. He missed Russia. He misjudged Manchin. So he's feeling shaky and he's feeling cornered. And like you said, you got Russia testing him. You got the Fed has to make a move soon, oil is going to go up over $100 a barrel probably. The guy sees the writing on the wall. They give him polling, Geraldo. Today they gave him polling, the last three polls, 40, 39, 40 approval rating.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: About the same as Trump.

utterances.speaker: WATTERSL
utterances.sentences: Not good, Geraldo, not good. The guy needs a Bourbon. That's what I would recommend.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Well, I volunteer to help him out there. So, you saw that press conference, right, judge. Biden was in two hours on his feet, lot of the questions were just as snotty as you can be.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: You know, Geraldo, you know, I listen to all the questions --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: But he answered.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: No. I've listened to all the questions you've asked these three --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: And yours are too hard?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: And you're trying to draw -- no, not at all. You're trying to draw distinction between age and confidence. There is no -- there is a total difference between you, you are older and someone like Joe Biden. He is losing it. I'm not going to be --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: He is much older than I am, eight months.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Well, good. I'm glad to hear that. Eight months? Okay. But that's where you're going with your question. You are, together you are focused. I don't agree with most of the stuff you say, but I still love you, okay. Joe Biden is incapable --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: We're like and old prom couple.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes, that's my line, the old prom couple. But Joe Biden is incapable of handling all the pressure and we see it all the time. He's turning into like a curmudgeon. You know, like someone who, you know, is angry all the time. Don't ask me about inflation! And don't ask me about a topic I don't want to talk about today because I can't -- I can't cover two subjects at once. And you are a son of a B for asking me that.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Go back to Greg's point. He said that it was a stupid question.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: But that's his --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: No such thing as a stupid question, Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: But no, no. But here's the bottom line. He wanted an answer from Joe Biden. Joe Biden couldn't be nimble like Dana suggested. He couldn't address it because he was only focused on that one thing. And I give credit to Dana. If you recall, when this broke yesterday, who was the first person who said if I were talking to the president I would say you got to pick up the phone, you got to call our very own Peter Doocy and just, you know, make things right. And that's exactly what he did.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes. I do think that was a pretty --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: And by the way --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- I think that they -- I'm sure that Jen Psaki was probably her first thought. PIRRO: But I want a simple more thing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Our very own Dana Perino.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: And our very own Peter Doocy was a class act because he went right past it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: And he treated it like it was nothing.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I love that too.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: He's a class act.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He's our very own Peter Doocy.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Our very own.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: So, would you ever say our very own Geraldo?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, we can now.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Say it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Our very own Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Okay. On that note, up next, massive outrage over one of Black Lives Matter chapter just said while yet another officer has died in the line of duty.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Violence against police officers getting even deadlier. The NYPD paying tribute this afternoon after a second officer has died just days after a suspect shot him and his partner while both were responding to a domestic dispute. That comes as a Black Lives Matter chapter from Washington, D.C., faces backlash from police groups after complaining of copaganda and saying officers who get shot should not be called heroes, tweeting this, "Look at the reaction and coverage tonight. Tear jerker press conferences and proclamations of heroes coming soon. Being black in D.C. is more dangerous than any job." First, let us all express our condolences to Officer Mora and his family. We're really -- we're hoping that he would make it, unfortunately, that was not the case. So judge, we woke up this morning and found out that the Black Lives Matter chapter in D.C. had tweeted that. I would imagine that your head exploded.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes. It's been exploding a lot in the last month. There has been a police officer shot every day in this country since the beginning of the year. And we've had four cops shot in New York City in the past week. Most of them are victims of just ambushes. And the bottom line is this, you've got all of these politicians who now come out and say, you know, we stand with the police and all this nonsense. They don't stand with the police because they were in favor of defunding, they were in favor of eliminating bail, releasing criminals and lowering criminal charges. And then all of a sudden because the winds kind of blown in favor of the police officers, they want to be, you know, out there with the group. Well, you know what, they ought to put their money where their mouth is. And the bottom line in this country is, until we start respecting cops, until we tell our children to respect cops, nothing is going to change because these politicians aren't going to change. They are activists, social justice warriors. I never knew what that meant, now I know what it means. You know, they talk about white privilege. This is criminal privilege. Criminals have all the privilege. And you've got Black Lives Matter, the organization, not the movement. I want to be really clear. If they care about what their title alleges, then they would want to be in the inner cities where most of the victims of crime are African- Americans and Brown children. That's why you got Eric Adams saying, I'm going to start really bringing in street crime units again, I'm going to start focusing on where these kids are. utterances.utterance: No, no, no. Half the country will never return. It's like a religion now, COVIDism. I can make up words too now, Greg. You started seeing the cracks though when Gayle King said she wanted to break the lock down and then run buck naked through Times Square. Then you have Maher coming out. You have AOC, you know, she got sick partying down in South Beach. So there is part of the party that wants to live free. But there is going to be people that are bitter clingers, remember those, the bitter clingers, the dead-enders, and they are going to stay until there is only one more case count in the United States because, judge, it's given their life meaning. They like the structure. They like to submit. Before, maybe they didn't have a way to find meaning in their lives, but now they have a doctor and they have a ritual, they are, you know, Cuomo- sexuals. They worship Fauci. And maybe it's in place of religion. I don't know, but there is a part of a human desire to kind of want rules to follow and then be able to judge other people that don't follow those rules. Now, the media likes it too because the media, number one, it gives them ratings and number two, it lets them be the snobs that they naturally are. So, while they're telling people what to do, other people will, yes, they will follow those rules. They will wear the face shield while they wash their blueberries with gloves and that will never end. And that will never end. And you know, Pfizer's got the money train going. These governors have the emergency powers. They're going to milk it for as long as possible.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Okay, so Dana, I saw you writing something down.

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.utterance: I'm writing furiously.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Go ahead.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, a couple of things. So, I think that one of the reasons you see Biden's numbers where they are is there's a lot of things, but one of the big ones is he didn't crush the virus, but also there is a wariness because we are not returning to normal. And there are -- now there is a reluctance to return to normal. And you had what I wrote down was that there is this poll this week that said that people who are twice vaccinated and boosted are more worried about getting COVID right now than the unvaccinated are worried about getting COVID. Also you have this other dynamic though with parents. I think 2022 is going to be the year that the parents roar and you will see this across the country. We saw it in Virginia, a little bit in New Jersey. You're going to see it across the country. Sixty-five percent of parents said they were more worried about their kids missing school than they were about their kids getting COVID. Only 30 percent said they were worried that -- for that. We had this situation in New York where they wear masks for a month. This is supposed to -- it's supposed to end a week from now. Then the governor, she got thrown out and the court said last night, actually no. We're throwing that out. There's a stay and now we're going to -- it's a week more. And instead of just taking the win and being a leader, she said she wants to fight it in court.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And what she could have said is New Yorkers, you did a great job, our case numbers are down, we can go back to not wearing masks in public places, vaccine rules, et cetera, et cetera. They told us to follow the science, but now they are not, and I think that that's why you see Biden's numbers also continuing to creep up.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: It's interesting how you made the connection between the two, but Geraldo, I want to ask you. There are some polls that are saying that younger people are more worried than medically vulnerable older people.

utterances.speaker: GUTFEDL
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Is that indoctrination? Is that a continuation? Because if you are older, you know that you're vulnerable.

utterances.speaker: GERALDO RIVERA, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.utterance: Erica and I last night, my wife Erica and I had a discussion about the various generations and how much more woke the younger people are, how they are -- they seized on to something. But I am - - I like Bari Weiss. I like Bill Maher, but I'm with Whoopi Goldberg on this. How dare you be so flippant? I mean, as you know, I lost my beloved nephew Bobby Reid, 868,000 Americans have died. I mean, it's a number that you have to really gulp, 868,000 Americans have died. You know, it's -- it will come. It's happening. Why rush it? And in terms of those Virginia parents, they send their unvaccinated kid to a school that's requiring vaccinations, they have to get ready for that child to be isolated in the auditorium, because that's the rule and that -- and you're not -- you are exposing -- even if you think the risk is minuscule in your own heart. That's the rule, you follow the rule. You know, you -- the reason the disease is so worrisome is that it is infectious and you can give it to someone else that it's not you. In other words, you are making the choice not to be vaccinated, you give the disease to someone who has not made that choice, a kid under five years old for example. I think that just calm down, it's coming. Week, two weeks, a month, six m months, some people forever, look at the Japanese, that's okay, not me. But, you know, that's the way it is.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Okay, so Greg, okay, Loudoun County is ground zero. They elected a governor. The governor says they don't have to wear masks. The schools are now segregating the kids.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'm all for that.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: (Inaudible).

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Effective risk management is not flippant. I don't see anything flippant about that. When the risk is minuscule and you understand risk management, you become the adult in the room and you make the decision. It's the person that uses --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Well, you can't make the decision for me.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, yes I can. I'm not allowing you to tell me to wear a mask.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Then I'm saying you can't come over.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: But, no.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, I'm not coming over to your giant house.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right. Some people --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: There is a room you could go.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, I know the panic room. Something insidious is happening right now. People are becoming okay with this creeping incrementalism, this authoritarianism. It doesn't land on your planet and a giant crate marked authoritarianism. It's like the slow boiling water that a frog is placed and you don't know until entertainers and journalists and the radical we've known for years, Geraldo, starts sounding like the man starts embracing the side of enforcement. Start saying like we can't have any risk in our lives! It all has to be zero or you are evil! That's B.S., right? Right now, you got to be aware of wars that don't have endings. We saw that with Afghanistan. We saw that with the drug war. If you don't want to war without an end, it's up to the sentiment of the population to declare the war over. That means you stop wearing your mask. If you go to stores and you got to restaurants or any establishment and they ask you to wear your mask, you say you know what coming essay, you know what, I'm following the science and you leave. It's time for everybody, I'm not talking about me. I'm not talking about Don Lemon. I'm not talking about Whoopi. I'm talking about the Americans, the viewers, the general public. They have to civilly disobey an end this thing once and for all because the problem is the government is lying to you. They don't -- they act as though the risk of a 10-year-old is the same as an obese 65-year-old smoker. That's B.S. Stop applying different risk to different people.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: It's also a question of manners, good manners.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, no, no. It's actually rude. It's actually rude

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: You scare people by not wearing a mask.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, you --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: No. If you wear the mask.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: -- you just called people flippant --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: You wear the mask.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: -- who've actually been thinking about this for two years. There is no flippancy in making a risk management decision.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Take a deep breath, one more month, two more months.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You've been saying -- you're even saying that for years.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: If it wasn't for omicron --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We need to flatten Geraldo's curve.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: If it wasn't omicron -- if it wasn't for omicron, we would've been out of this.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes, but it's not lethal. It's not lethal.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Omicron is highly contagious in miles. The masks don't work. It is time to get back to normal even if normal is living with COVID, we have to understand what we've lost because you have accepted the incrementalism of authoritarianism. You got used to the boiling water, Geraldo. That is so not Geraldo in the '70s.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I am a -- I'm a well-mannered person.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That is not Geraldo of the '80s.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I don't want to scare people.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That is not even Geraldo of the '90s.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I don't want scare -- I don't want to freak people out.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Okay. All right everybody, coming up --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I don't want --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Speaking of blowing up, Biden blowing up at Peter Doocy, but it isn't the first time. Is the president cracking under pressure?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: President Biden has a lot on his plate right now from raging inflation, cold war with Russia, plunging poll numbers and a ton of other headaches. Now, new questions over whether he is buckling under the enormous weight of multiple crises. The president's frustration is boiling to the surface as he is caught on a hot mike cursing at our Peter Doocy and it's not the first time the president has lashed out.

utterances.speaker: PETER DOOCY, FOX NEWS WHITE HOUSE CORRESPONDENT
utterances.utterance: Do you think that that might incentivize more people to come over illegally?

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA
utterances.utterance: If you guys keep sending that garbage out, yes.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.utterance: Why are you so confident it will change his behavior, Mr. President?

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.utterance: I'm not confident he'll change his behavior. What the hell, what do you do all the time?

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.utterance: Mr. President, can I ask you a quick question on Israel before you drive away since it's so important?

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.utterance: No, you can't.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.utterance: Why are you waiting on Putin to make the first move, sir?

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.utterance: What a stupid question.

utterances.speaker: DOOCY
utterances.utterance: Do you think inflation is a political liability?

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.utterance: It's a great asset. More inflation. What a stupid son of a (BLEEP).

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: The president calling Peter to quote, "clear the air" after that encounter. The press secretary Jen Psaki addressing the outburst earlier.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.utterance: Does the president regret saying what he said about Peter?

utterances.speaker: JEN PSAKI, WHITE HOUSE PRESS SECRETARY
utterances.utterance: Peter spoke to this. The president called him. He conveyed to him that it was nothing personal, man, and also acknowledged that all of you are going to ask him a range of questions. So, I think that speaks for itself.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: You know, Greg, on "Hannity" to last night, actually several weeks ago is where it originated. I called Dan Bongino a son of a bitch and no one even got mad at me.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. When do we expect that from you, Geraldo? You know, you did make a mistake though. You referred to him as our Peter Doocy. It's our very own Peter Doocy, remember. We don't say that about anybody else to the network, but we always have to say our very own Peter Doocy. But Biden was right, it was a dumb question. Will inflation hurt your chances in the midterm? Of course it will. So, actually Biden was correct. It was a dumb question, but that's the best part about Fox News. We aren't CNN. We aren't wetting our shorts and calling this, you know, an attack on democracy or an insurrection. Every time Acosta acted like a stone tool and got CNN's cavalcade of Karens, you know, fretted about the coming reign of terror. The fact that we find this hilarious and that we can make fun of Peter Doocy says everything about how much fun this network is. But if it were Jim Acosta, they'd have to change Anderson Cooper's sheets. Carl Bernstein would say it's worse than Watergate. And also, if you didn't mind Trump parading the press, you sure -- you shouldn't mind now. I would prefer much more berating of the press and much less real-world problems that you mentioned. All of those real-world problems that are under Biden, I will take that over insults to the press. I think we should be more obnoxious to the press. I do my best.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I really am very concerned about the real world problem in Ukraine.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: But I don't want to be a bummer right now. Don't you, Dana, think that the hit on Biden about his senility, alleged senility and losing his cognitive decline, you know, isn't that a little much?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I mean, I don't --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I mean --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That's really not what this is about, really. And no, and I don't say things like that.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: You don't think its --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I don't say things like that about him.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: You don't.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But I do think this. There was a -- in the campaign when he was in the basement, there was this narrative that he was a nice older gentleman who likes ice cream --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: -- and everything would return to normal or pre-COVID, right? Everything would be okay. And it turns out that he actually is just like us, and he's got an edge, and he is on a hot mike. He could get caught. We could get caught on a hot mic at any moment so I'm a little bit sympathetic to that. But he also showed a lack of being able to be nimble even if it is a dumb question. Take the opportunity and talk to the American people and say, I know inflation is a problem for you. I hear about it -- I heard it from Mary Ann (ph) who was there telling me about the hamburger.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: The hamburgers.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: A very old Mary Anne (ph).

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And that's why I have these people in here today, Peter, and that's what we are going to work on. I'm not too worried about the campaign, but I'm going to -- like just to be able to take an opportunity. The press is going to ask you whatever they ask you, just always like just swing and try to hit it.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: You rely so much on your mom. Your mom about my age, probably a little younger than me and returns her texts. Guiding you morally and philosophically even though you disagree. Now, don't you think that people are too quick to pull the trigger on senility and, you know, all that?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I mean, don't we older folks sometimes bring our wisdom that is very necessary.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I haven't seen any wisdom from Joe Biden, Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: None at all?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No, not a lot of wisdom. But here's what I think. To compare this to the Trump thing, the difference is, is that the media was calling Trump a racist Russian trader and trying to get him impeached.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right. Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Our very own stupid son of a bitch just asked him about a policy question. He asked him policy so, okay, yes. Like have a little more discipline. I think it's fair as Dana said to say is everything okay because this is not something that normal people do. He's lost control of the presidency. He's obviously missed the last two waves. He missed inflation. He missed Russia. He misjudged Manchin. So he's feeling shaky and he's feeling cornered. And like you said, you got Russia testing him. You got the Fed has to make a move soon, oil is going to go up over $100 a barrel probably. The guy sees the writing on the wall. They give him polling, Geraldo. Today they gave him polling, the last three polls, 40, 39, 40 approval rating.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: About the same as Trump.

utterances.speaker: WATTERSL
utterances.utterance: Not good, Geraldo, not good. The guy needs a Bourbon. That's what I would recommend.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Well, I volunteer to help him out there. So, you saw that press conference, right, judge. Biden was in two hours on his feet, lot of the questions were just as snotty as you can be.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: You know, Geraldo, you know, I listen to all the questions --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: But he answered.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: No. I've listened to all the questions you've asked these three --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: And yours are too hard?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: And you're trying to draw -- no, not at all. You're trying to draw distinction between age and confidence. There is no -- there is a total difference between you, you are older and someone like Joe Biden. He is losing it. I'm not going to be --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: He is much older than I am, eight months.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Well, good. I'm glad to hear that. Eight months? Okay. But that's where you're going with your question. You are, together you are focused. I don't agree with most of the stuff you say, but I still love you, okay. Joe Biden is incapable --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: We're like and old prom couple.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes, that's my line, the old prom couple. But Joe Biden is incapable of handling all the pressure and we see it all the time. He's turning into like a curmudgeon. You know, like someone who, you know, is angry all the time. Don't ask me about inflation! And don't ask me about a topic I don't want to talk about today because I can't -- I can't cover two subjects at once. And you are a son of a B for asking me that.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Go back to Greg's point. He said that it was a stupid question.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: But that's his --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No such thing as a stupid question, Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: But no, no. But here's the bottom line. He wanted an answer from Joe Biden. Joe Biden couldn't be nimble like Dana suggested. He couldn't address it because he was only focused on that one thing. And I give credit to Dana. If you recall, when this broke yesterday, who was the first person who said if I were talking to the president I would say you got to pick up the phone, you got to call our very own Peter Doocy and just, you know, make things right. And that's exactly what he did.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes. I do think that was a pretty --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: And by the way --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: -- I think that they -- I'm sure that Jen Psaki was probably her first thought. PIRRO: But I want a simple more thing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Our very own Dana Perino.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: And our very own Peter Doocy was a class act because he went right past it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: And he treated it like it was nothing.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I love that too.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: He's a class act.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He's our very own Peter Doocy.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Our very own.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: So, would you ever say our very own Geraldo?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, we can now.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Say it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Our very own Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Okay. On that note, up next, massive outrage over one of Black Lives Matter chapter just said while yet another officer has died in the line of duty.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Violence against police officers getting even deadlier. The NYPD paying tribute this afternoon after a second officer has died just days after a suspect shot him and his partner while both were responding to a domestic dispute. That comes as a Black Lives Matter chapter from Washington, D.C., faces backlash from police groups after complaining of copaganda and saying officers who get shot should not be called heroes, tweeting this, "Look at the reaction and coverage tonight. Tear jerker press conferences and proclamations of heroes coming soon. Being black in D.C. is more dangerous than any job." First, let us all express our condolences to Officer Mora and his family. We're really -- we're hoping that he would make it, unfortunately, that was not the case. So judge, we woke up this morning and found out that the Black Lives Matter chapter in D.C. had tweeted that. I would imagine that your head exploded.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes. It's been exploding a lot in the last month. There has been a police officer shot every day in this country since the beginning of the year. And we've had four cops shot in New York City in the past week. Most of them are victims of just ambushes. And the bottom line is this, you've got all of these politicians who now come out and say, you know, we stand with the police and all this nonsense. They don't stand with the police because they were in favor of defunding, they were in favor of eliminating bail, releasing criminals and lowering criminal charges. And then all of a sudden because the winds kind of blown in favor of the police officers, they want to be, you know, out there with the group. Well, you know what, they ought to put their money where their mouth is. And the bottom line in this country is, until we start respecting cops, until we tell our children to respect cops, nothing is going to change because these politicians aren't going to change. They are activists, social justice warriors. I never knew what that meant, now I know what it means. You know, they talk about white privilege. This is criminal privilege. Criminals have all the privilege. And you've got Black Lives Matter, the organization, not the movement. I want to be really clear. If they care about what their title alleges, then they would want to be in the inner cities where most of the victims of crime are African- Americans and Brown children. That's why you got Eric Adams saying, I'm going to start really bringing in street crime units again, I'm going to start focusing on where these kids are. If you really care about black children, then get involved in mentoring, put some kind of after-school program in, give them an internship, make believe you care for the Black lives that are being lost. These are just money hucksters who are doing nothing but promoting division in this country.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Over to you, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well done. Well said. It's not that surprising, because you have to understand, there is an underlying streak in BLM that is anti-cop. It is there -- they happen to sucker the media into thinking it was something else. And so, the media treated them with an exalted reverence. Even as police were getting shot, you actually couldn't say anything. If you said blue lives matter or all lives matter, somehow that was an attack on BLM and you were racist. The media embrace the narrative that contributed to a nationwide Ferguson Effect, right, devaluing a police and ultimately a crime wave in the crumbling of cities run by liberals. So, what do you think of the smash and grabs, the random murders, the carjackings, the gang violence comes from? It was an acceptance of an idea that America was hopelessly corrupt, and therefore looting and arson were seen as justifiable behavior. That opened the doors to progressive nightmares like no cash bail, early release of violent felons, defunding the police, early retirement of cops. All of this came from the same mentality. And it is an underlying anti- police streak that it's been part of activism for decades.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Geraldo, you are expressing some feelings about this earlier.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I was deeply touched by the judge's recitation just then. I was -- it was slammed. It was a slam in my heart when Jason Rivera, the first cop, the 22-year-old was dead on the scene, and Mora was clinging to life. It just -- you could weep. It was so, so horrible. And just to continue this whole idea of how cops have been pilloried, the riots, the George Floyd riots where there were -- there were the Molotov cocktails and assaulted and every crap you could think of thrown at them. And still, they held the thin blue line, the thin blue line separating civilization from anarchy. But I tell you that thing about copaganda in DC from that BLM chapter, being Black is more dangerous than any job, he's right. DC had 227 murders last year. The vast majority of them -- almost all of them Black, including 33 women and children. Where it was Black Lives Matter? Where was Black Lives Matter? Do Black lives really matter or do Black lives only matter when a cop is involved? 227 murders, what did BLM -- what did that big mouth do about the 227 mostly Black people who were murdered in DC by mostly Black people? What did you do? You did nothing. You did nothing.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Jesse, last word to you.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I would just say that police officers are almost always saving Black lives from Black on Black crime and that needs to be acknowledged. It was a bait and switch BLM. It started off as a nice movement. Trump bought into it. Remember, the George Floyd, he said it was terrible. Everyone thought so. Corporate America bought into it. Then what happened? Then they started burning everything. And then the people that were leading this thing started looting it and buying luxury spreads in California and the Caribbean. And then, we get all these statements from these like -- sounds like communist revolutionaries. And they say, oh, no, that was just a chapter that was unaffiliated with a national organization. That happened 10 times. You start thinking like, oh, my God, this isn't what they said it was. And I always look at these movements for their results. Where are the results? You didn't get police reform. You got a lot of property damage. You defund to the police it cost a lot of Black lives. And now, the brand has sunk to below 50 percent approval. And now everyone's thinking, oh my God, what have we gotten ourselves involved in?

utterances.speaker: PERINO

They take the guys, they take their picture, they interview them, and then like 15 minutes later, they lead them outside the fence and let them back into Slovakia. And that's the whole thing, and it works. And that's kind of what they do in everything in Hungary. It's not a radical country. It's not a theocracy. It's a very sort of simple, sweet country with some problems like every country, but they just kind of tried to make it better. That's all they do. utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh, all right. We'll take it around the table. That sounds like a nice idea. Judge Jeanine.

And the Hungarian government is basically just said out loud, we don't like this. This is subverting democracy. I don't think it's most people's

In other words, it's a program of destruction aimed at the West. Now, I don't -- you know, I don't know what his motive is. I'm certainly not going to guess. People are complicated. He clearly is.
